intro: Spermacoce stricta var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf spurred cucumber, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by elliptical, woody fruits that split open to release its seeds. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is often found in forest understories and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
